page.title: 12ALDERLEY EDGE ECOLOGY
page.content: Alderley edge is in cheshire it has 232 acres of land.The edge is mostly covered with trees there are sycamore silver birch,Oak,Scots Pine and very few of Ash.They have afew flowers which are dandelions,Ragged Roben,Blue bells and Wood Anemone At the Edge you sometimes see and hear among the trees Woodpeckers,Tree_creepers,Crows,Jays, Willow warblers and Wood warblers and other common birds.You will see lots of animals such as Frogs, Rabbits and Squirrels.You may just see a Badger. Horses must follow the Horse signs because up on the Edge it can get very boggy.Also the horses hooves have been making holes in the soils so the plants cannot grow.There are also two springs one called Holy Well and the other called Wizards Well(see page14)
